On june 30, 2013
Doomys

Welcome to the second questions thread!

Use this thread for any small questions you have, number each question like this 'Q12', 'Q13'.
When answering a question mention it's number like this 'A12', 'A13'.
This will make the questions easier to follow.

Example:
Player A:
Q21: "How can I get more recruits?"

Player B:
A21: "Try using the thread named 'Recruit of the heart'"

Please try to be patient, questions are not always answered in order. Wait until somebody answers your question.

If things become too complicated feel free to repost any question again in it's own thread.

Thanks

[5379947]

Q1: If you have loader and are using an infernal tube (which almost never reloads) will loader trigger on the second weapon used?

I don't have any armies to test this with (it requires a munitions also because the tube only starts with 1 ammo).
On july 3, 2013
Doomys

A1: The first weapon he needs to reload will be reloaded with loader.

So if he doesn't empty any clips before the munitions/rucksack gives an infernal tube shell, he should use loader to restock his infernal tube. (That's considering that he doesn't switch to an other weapon after firing)

On july 4, 2013
Comody

On july 5, 2013
Kompera

A2. Well, maybe. The Compensator "reduces waiting time after a shot by 30%."
Which should apply to any weapon. It is said to apply to the Knife, which doesn't fire anything at all.
On july 5, 2013
Comody

The knife is a continuous attack, that's why the Compensator does affect the knife. With the DB shotgun, the trooper has to re-load the weapon and Compensator doesn't take effect like the skills says "reduces waiting time after a shot by 30%." that's why it doesn't affect the DB shotgun 'cause the troopers re-loads the weapon when Compensator affects the trooper with continuous attacks.

Comody
kipisekQ: Is that possible to level up a soldier and get smart skill?

Yes all skills, except those that required to be certain levels to be able to unlock them and to be offered like:

Black Hole Grenade:
Required level to unlock the skill: 13 ^
Level in which this skill can be offered: 13 ^

Smart is a level 1 skill, so, you will have a chance to get this skill offered to you when your trooper levels up.

[5975616]

Does it matter where I place my spy in my command order?

I currently have 10 troopers, and my spy is #6 in my command sequence. But I never see him in the first wave of enemy troops. Sometimes not even in the second.

If I do not place him in the first 4 positions, will he never infiltrate the first wave of enemy troops?

Or is it completely random and can I put him anywhere in my command sequence?

Thanks

On july 28, 2013
[281455]
KickingUrAss

Does it matter where I place my spy in my command order?

I currently have 10 troopers, and my spy is #6 in my command sequence. But I never see him in the first wave of enemy troops. Sometimes not even in the second.

If I do not place him in the first 4 positions, will he never infiltrate the first wave of enemy troops?

Or is it completely random and can I put him anywhere in my command sequence?

Thanks

Spies deploy in random order (if you have several), but if you put them to the last position you will have more chances to see them with 2nd or 3rd enemies wave.

Also, I have an army with 6 troopers and 2 of them are spies.
I had next order : Spy 1 - Trooper - Trooper - Trooper - Spy 2 - Trooper.

Spy 1 deploys with 1st enemy wave (in 6x6 PvP battle usually), and Spy 2 deploys at 4th spot of my 1st wave.

For armies with 12 troopers, the order of spies doesn't matter too much, if only the first thing I've said
On july 29, 2013
Cripto
KickingUrAss

Does it matter where I place my spy in my command order?

I currently have 10 troopers, and my spy is #6 in my command sequence. But I never see him in the first wave of enemy troops. Sometimes not even in the second.

If I do not place him in the first 4 positions, will he never infiltrate the first wave of enemy troops?

Or is it completely random and can I put him anywhere in my command sequence?

Thanks

For every 4 troopers in an army, 1 spy can be deployed in their base. So...

4 enemies - 1 spy
8 enemies - 2 spies
12 enemies - 3 spies

Wherever they come out is completely random, but if you have more spies than you can deploy against a particular opponent, the spy/ies placed higher in your deployment order gets priority. The ones that aren't deployed will show up wherever they're placed in your command order.

Hope I covered everything

On july 30, 2013
[281455]
Cripto

For every 4 troopers in an army, 1 spy can be deployed in their base. So...

4 enemies - 1 spy
8 enemies - 2 spies
12 enemies - 3 spies

Wherever they come out is completely random, but if you have more spies than you can deploy against a particular opponent, the spy/ies placed higher in your deployment order gets priority. The ones that aren't deployed will show up wherever they're placed in your command order.

Hope I covered everything

C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Macromedia\Flash Player\macromedia.com\support\flashplayer\sys\

And


C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Macromedia\Flash Player\#SharedObjects\8XG368X4\

[4286389]

The wise thing to do is take a screenshot of your trooper's skills screen before you hit the button, but if you didn't, get into a fight and check your trooper's skills there (by clicking on the trooper as he fights onscreen). If you've already done all your fights, just replay one of them.

The wise thing to do is to open a new tab when you click the level up option. Without closing/refreshing the original tab, you can check the trooper's skill there.

On december 14, 2013
Pause

Hi Nosperatus0

Nosperatus0Is it never possible to erase trooper which is already made?? ever??

You can not erase a trooper. Never ever. Not under any circumstances.

You also can not...
take back a skill choice, erase a skill, rename a trooper a second time, rename the account.

These are all things that you will need to be careful about. A mistake is forever.


however... you may start a whole new army.
While learning the game many players abandon their first army. Most players have more than one army going at the same time.
This is allowed and recommended. It's just more fun.


Nosperatus0And one more thing, i have an account which i CERTAINLY made from the computer im using right now. But i didnt make password for it then... and now it says 'u should use the computer u've used when u wanna change the password' .... what the hell??? would be really grateful if anyone knows about it.

This can happen.
You have done nothing wrong and your not the first player to be in this situation.

Unfortunately there is nothing anyone can do to help you now.
A password must be set immediately after the army's creation. Once set the password can be changed later.


I am sorry to say this Nosperatus but I highly recommended abandoning the army and starting a new one.
I know it feels bad, we have all been there.

An army without a password will be trolled sooner or later, it will not work out well if your going to use it in one of our games/tournaments.


Maybe you can name the new accout/troopers in honor of the old one, you can take what you'v learned from the first one and apply it to the second.
If you do start a new army I can send you a couple of recruites to get you going faster, just send me the link by private message

On february 7, 2014
45424

It's related to fighting style (and priority).

Let's say you're using a weapon with range 3 (without Smart). One enemy (Spy) is just beside you (range 1) fully sabotaged, and another (Doctor) with bait is 10 units away also fully sabotaged. Your priority target is set to Spy, but since the Doctor has bait, the priority is Doctor > Spy.

If you're Hunter style, you'll go hunt down the one with highest priority on the whole field, so you're going after the Doctor with bait.

If you're Standard style, you'll attack the one with highest priority within your range, so you'll attack the Spy.

If you're Defender style, you'll try to back out of all enemies' range, so you'll back off 1 unit, then attack the Spy.

Kompera
KurtI already have an army and stuff and i logged in, but my army has apparently dissapeared, because when i tried to search for it, it said it didnt exist. any help as to why this is happening?

My answer is in the form of a question: Why did you need to "search for it"? Any decent browser remembers your history, and you should only have to type a few characters of the name to get it to auto-complete it for you.

If you can't find it still, and won't use a decent browser, then I suggest creating a new army and bookmarking it to avoid losing it again.

[7200765]

Ok, im having a hard time trying to understand the aim and critical %
How do they work? Many weapons have a 100% aim but they miss a lot of shots, and what about critical? 100% critical means that every single shot to the chest/head gives a killshot?
On march 13, 2014
[8174833]
PicheleiroOk, im having a hard time trying to understand the aim and critical %
How do they work? Many weapons have a 100% aim but they miss a lot of shots, and what about critical? 100% critical means that every single shot to the chest/head gives a killshot?

The chance of hitting the target depends on: dodger of the target, speed of the target (if he's moving) and the aim of your weapon.

If your weapon has less than 100% then it contributes for more missing, if it has 100% is neutral, and if is >100% then it decreases the chance of missing.

Criticals ins't %, since Sparrowhalk with Hydrobulets have 50x*4 = 200x and can still don't score a fatal hit.

Bulletproof vest protects against this as you have shown.

1. Headshot! 2. Straight to the heart! 3. Punctured Lung! 4. Gutshot!

Having said that, I don't know if it is true.

If you are talking about the Power number, that's strictly based on the number of your soldiers and the number of levels they have.

(number of soldiers x5) + (number of total levels you have gained, not counting the first)
On december 22, 2014
[4245227]

So I must have more that points if I want up on the table?
On december 22, 2014
[281455]
BlackMambaaSo I must have more that points if I want up on the table?

Yes. More points = more troopers (12 max) and higher amount of levels that your troopers have:

1-lvl 1-man army has 1x5 = 5 power;
1-lvl 2-man army has 1x5 + 1x1 = 6 power;
1-lvl 3-man army has 1x5 + 2x1 = 7 power;
etc
1-lvl 99-man army has 1x5 + 98x1 = 103 power;
etc

12-lvl 1-men army has 12x5 = 60 power;
12-lvl 2-men army has 12x5 + 12x1 = 72 power;
12-lvl 3-men army has 12x5 + 12x2 = 84 power;
etc.

[281455]
Gadget57Look at the helicopter's ammunition. Its CURRENT ammo clip was empty, but it had PLENTY OF SPARE AMMO to use for later.

Have you ever seen Munitions add ammo into the clip itself?

They always add ammo as spare backup. The only reason : Vehicles don't get ammo from Munitions/Rucksack skill even if there is a mark above them (that appears with next wave) that they get it.

It's a bug (about incoming ammo mark for vehicles) or you can say that the bug is about Vehicles not getting real ammo from Munitions (for me it's reality )
On february 7, 2015
Pause

You will need to tap space bar to see what KOREA is talking about.

Next time you see this bug watch the replay to the second wave, note the vehicle's ammo.
Restart the replay, click once on the game window (to give it focus) and then hit your space bar once. Doing this shows a different amount of ammo just like KOREA is talking about.

On april 10, 2015
pickupsticks

If you make it so that you can't skip your own armies but have to defeat them, then there's nothing to stop you giving the higher-placed army a terrible deployment and combat-order set up, e.g. starting everyone with a pistol.
For armies with anything like a similar strength this should make it pretty straight-forward to pass them with just one attack spent.

In theory, armies next to each other in the CC should be around the same strength, unless a higher-powered army is climbing the table in which case they should be able to beat them without all the tweaking shenanigans. Also for the cost of one attack.

Not that I'm arguing for or against a ruling here, just thinking out loud about some scenarios. I'm not active in the CC at the moment (as you may have noticed) so this doesn't really affect me - and I'd be happy with a ruling either way anyway. I'm easy going, me.

I've had that several times. It happenes when the battle has a glitch (due Knife or something else) and I have to re-wind it to watch an ending.

1) So I restart the reply,

2) click on the screen once (to set a pause and unlock re-winds),

3) then click one more time to unpause the battle and

4) press SpaceBar (as many times as needed, 1 press = 1 re-wind) to re-wind the battle.

"The head over heels position" of troopers depend on the time you press the Spacebar (at once or in a half of the second or in the second etc)

KOFKOREA3. and 4. Suspicious gives +200 initiative for each and every spy that appears on your side ...

for each and every opponent's spy*

KOFKOREA3. and 4. ... when a trooper that has Suspicious appears in the same wave

in the same wave on your side*

In case of your Spy on opponent's side, your Spy doesn't get any initiative with Suspicious! So Spy gets initiative with that skill only when he appears on your own side (in vehicle [most often] or not) with an opponent's spy on your side too.

On june 29, 2015
[281455]
CrystalizeHi guys, I'm new around here. I just got light tank when I leveled up with one of my troops and I thought it would be nice to have in my army. Though the troop that got it didn't enter the any fight with a tank in any of todays fights. Is it random if he uses the tank or not or are there settings I have to change?

It's random. If your guys with a tank has Pilot's helmet then you have more chances to see the tank on battlefield. All the rest helmets have equal chances to use the tank.

Also, there is a bug when the Pilot gets Light Tank before Motorcycle. In that case, Pilot will use Motorcycle only (<< that's what I heard).
On june 29, 2015

On july 5, 2015
Pause

marcelencioCan i do something to solve this? No, arrr or maybe...?
It's one of the sillyer things about this game and there is no good solution.

Generally if there is another gun available to them, then the trooper will change their weapon when it's empty instead of reloading it.
However in your reply I believe sprinter maybe plaing a part too.
Because both of your Mos-Tek troopers have sprinter the AI could be taking this skill into account when evaluate the troopers options.
In the case of your soldier, Max, it could be that reloading the Mos-Tek was going to be no faster then changing to FAMAS and moving in with sprinter.

If you don't mind I'd like to go into theory here.
At a later date you could try adding other skills, skills that either speed up the loading time or slow down the movement speed.
Consider... Nimble Fingers, Thermos of Coffee, Heavyweight or Heavy Armor.
And there is loader of course.

On july 23, 2015
[4286389]

He hit his target square on, but the trooper he targeted used tuck and roll to dodge the grenade. King of Boules only makes sure the grenade lands at your trooper's intended target (and not, like, half a screen away).

I'm pretty sure ordinary dodge chance bonuses (like from Take Cover) also still apply, but I could be wrong there. Also, Interception.

On august 4, 2015
KyleCosmos

Is there a way to expand the recruit history so that you can see all of your recruits?
On august 4, 2015
pickupsticks
KyleCosmosIs there a way to expand the recruit history so that you can see all of your recruits?

Kinda.

Go to the "command my troops" page (the one that ends /choice) and zoom. At full zoom, the troopers from your recruits will appear below your own troopers, probably spread over several pages. You can select each trooper and then a clickable link to the recruit army will appear with their details in the top left.
NB: this might not work on certain browsers - if zooming just makes things bigger and smaller but the layout of the flash item in the page doesn't change then try it in a different browser.
On august 5, 2015

Yes, there is a way to know offers in advance, though I don't know it. I just heard that that way existed.

Those armies with troopers at level 5 ... most likely, amry owner already pressed "upgrade" and know offers for them. So he waits before he get as many troopers in the army as he wants, then have them all al level 5 and choose helments according to the offers for all his troopers

E.g. Your first trooper is at level 5, you press an upgrade button and see the offer : Saboteur and Comms Officer. You choose Comms Officer. And you wanna have 12-men army after all. Then you hire 2nd trooper, 3rd trooper etc until you get 12. BUT imagine that when you will upgrade troopers #2..#12 to level 6 they won't have Saboteur in the offer at all. If you think that it may never happen then check it out

On august 17, 2015
[8640217]

They say that Munutions will increase the use of grenades. A munitions guy will use grenades more often than any other trooper.

Your trooper would benefit from spy, but your entire team will benefit from munitions since it refills all teamates ammo every wave.

If the rest of your team also haves grenades then munitions could encourage an entire team to use grenades more often.
If your team runs out of ammo, your team will be forced to use their fists and they might die quicker.

Snipers would benefit most from munitions since they can keep sniping wave after wave.

A spy will deploy on the enemy team and replace one of their troopers. A spy can do alot of damage to the enemy team very quickly.

If you want to improve the trooper, get spy. If you want to improve the whole team, get munitions.

pickupsticks

http://minitroopers.wikia.com/wiki/Pilot

The Wiki page strongly suggests that it only affects the deployment chance, not whether or not you are offered a vehicle when you level up. (which also tallies with my own personal experience)

The Wiki is based on a fairly large experimental sample size, so I'd be inclined to trust it.

There's a lot of other useful information on there, it's well worth having a read around if you have the time.

On september 19, 2015
[8640217]
ZajcekCan some one explain what happened

I took a look at that battle and I saw that that battle ended the second it began. This is because spies may or may not deploy so your spy came in your second wave but there were no other troopers so you automatically win the battle. It is one of the disadvantages of spies.

Lets say army 1 has a spy. Lets say army 1 fights army 2. Army 1 spy might get put in army 2 second wave. If army 2 beat army 1 while keeping the spy in the second wave then the battle will be over without the spy deploying at all.

A better example would be spiral team vs the surfing snivy
http://spiral-team.minitroopers.com/b...

As you can see, the surfing snivy has a spy named frenchie but sometimes he may not show up at all so he forfeits the battle. If your spy does not show up your army may forfeit the battle here is the surfing snivy spy.
http://thesurfing-snivy.minitroopers....

On january 17, 2016
[4286389]

I think Adrenaline is also a top-tier skill and for some setups worth picking over Twinoid. It's worth noting that both Adrenaline and Frenetic really need other skills to shine (Adrenaline wants dodging skills and footspeed, with Frenetic it depends on the weapon but shells, cold blooded, footspeed, whatever lets you make a first kill and move to the next one.)

On Point and Twinoid are more stand-alone skills and will usually make a bigger impact on relatively low-level troopers (under level 10 or so) though they remain worth picking afterwards.

My troops keep friendly firing punctured lung, headshot, etc... Is that the weakness of more troops?
On june 2, 2016
pickupsticks
Too_TonMy troops keep friendly firing punctured lung, headshot, etc... Is that the weakness of more troops?

Yeah, it's a problem.
Skills such as Suspicious, Friendly Fire, or the various accuracy boosters can help to reduce how often it happens - but in the main you'll be wanting to use your deployment order, default weapons and stance settings to try and keep your shotguns and automatic weapons where they don't put your other soldiers into the line of fire so often.
On june 2, 2016
[4286389]

Yes, of course.

I first installed an old version of Firefox, this one is perfectly adapted (it must be installed in the custom configuration or it will be automatically updated to the new version).
http://www.oldversion.fr/windows/mozi...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jMvHg...
then I followed this video in order to be able to put the flash back on my browsers especially since on the old version of Firefox it is easier to put the flash back on Firefox than on chrome.

then I opened Firefox with the flash and I put my army . In manage my army below we have pages with the reserve army . Just zoom in to see all the soldiers with their army links below.

I hope I have been clear
